poemContent: That's my first among us game printed on the leader-board, I was imposter that round I recall, I do remember how I won the game, Credits to my sheer intelligence and perfect play, ruined by some simple-minded folk, Have you encountered such idiocy sir? I provoke, I remember him telling the crew to vote, for me, green, he didn't even see me vent, this man didn't play on logic, just a stupid guess. "Green sus guys, he just is, K", And I now wonder, what must've been running through his brain? Abiding no among-us rules, Tips the scales of the crew, A paragraph, a flurry of arguments, evidence and lore of the game, toppled by the sorry retort "lol, K", "He's still sus though, Idk why", Green was the imposter, and then I died. 
